verses.text_plain: Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
verses.verse_html:
1Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain. ▼
▼ for…: or, of Solomon
 , ▼
▼ that…: Heb. that are builders of it in it

verses.text_plain: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
verses.verse_html: 2It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

verses.text_plain: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.
verses.verse_html:
5Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate. ▼
▼ his…: Heb. filled his quiver with them
 , ▼
▼ speak…: or, subdue, or, destroy

tokens.definition: דָבַר dâbar, daw-bar'; a primitive root; perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue:—answer, appoint, bid, command, commune, declare, destroy, give, name, promise, pronounce, rehearse, say, speak, be spokesman, subdue, talk, teach, tell, think, use (entreaties), utter, × well, × work.
